main event: A bright, white star-like object was observed traveling slowly across the sky in Pocahontas, Arkansas on February 29, 1967.
interesting points: The object faded from view after being visible for about one minute.
There were no sound or other physical effects associated with the sighting.
The description is consistent with that of a satellite observation.
Two B-52 bombers from the 97th Bomb Wing at Blytheville, Arkansas were in the area at the approximate time of the sighting.
The most logical explanation for this sighting is that the observer saw a satellite.
